ANTONIO CONTE could stay at Chelsea next season, according to Sky Sports expert Guillem Balague.

NAPOLI TO DEMAND EXPIRING SARRI CLAUSE

Napoli will demand compensation from any club looking to hire former boss Maurizio Sarri, despite his £7m release clause expiring on Thursday, according to Sky in Italy.

Sarri has been linked with a move to Chelsea, with Sky in Italy reporting that the Stamford Bridge club have a general agreement with him via his representatives to succeed Antonio Conte if he leaves his role as manager.

The 59-year-old left Napoli earlier this month, being replaced by former Chelsea manager Carlo Ancelotti, but club president Aurelio De Laurentiis does not want to let him go for free.

If Chelsea do want Sarri, Napoli will demand a payment, with De Laurentiis asking for the £7m (€8m) release clause to be paid.

It is also understood that Sarri is considering filing a lawsuit against Napoli for not releasing him from his contract, with Chelsea also looking into their options in terms of a lawsuit, or an appeal to FIFA.

Napoli might also take legal action against Sarri, as he is contracted to the club until 2020.

There are reports Maurizio Sarri told his closest collaborators that the move to Chelsea has been essentially abandoned.

According to CalcioNapoli24, the tactician confessed to his friends and co-workers that negotiations have broken down definitively.

The situation has been deteriorating over the last few days, when the club refused to pay the €8m release clause in his contract.

As that expired last night, Napoli made it clear through their lawyer Mattia Grassani today that “anyone who wants Sarri will have to negotiate directly with Napoli.

“Sarri is under contract until June 30, 2019. Napoli have already warned other clubs interested in Sarri that he is still on the payroll of this side. There are no clauses that allow Sarri to negotiate with other clubs without Napoli’s consent.”

Alternatives for Chelsea include Laurent Blanc and potentially ex-Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane, fresh from a third consecutive Champions League trophy.

This afternoon, Sarri's agent Alessandro Pellegrini shrugged off Sportitalia questions: "I don't know who Chelsea are, are they a football club?"

Kenedy 位置:翼鋒 年齡:22 外借球會:Newcastle(英超)

上陣場數:13 分鐘:1030 入球:2 助攻:2

Benitez等左佢咁耐唔係冇原因，Kenedy踢番佢最擅長既位置，加上有空間同球權比佢發揮，簡直判若兩人，當然技術同傳中係佢既強項之一，但係work rate同防守參與度方面既貢獻好大，可能同係車路士train開踢翼衛有關。Kenedy半季入面射入2球，交出2個助攻，獲選成為紐卡素3月份最佳球員，亦都係球隊護級既功臣之一，對Kenedy黎講係一個成功既球季。

前景: 預計Kenedy會參與pre season，因為pre season車路士實唔夠人腳。
另一方面，RB萊比錫、 拜仁、 PSG、 阿仙奴等球會有密切留意佢既表現，Kenedy本人亦表示願意留效紐卡素，但紐卡素方面未必比得起轉會費，希望以續借形式留人。個人認為續借去紐卡素對車路士同Kenedy都係一個好選擇。Kenedy實力同潛質係有，但要係車路士或其他大球會爭正選會有困難，係紐卡素佢有穩定既出場時間同空間比佢發揮，加上Benitez train年青球員有一手，來季留係紐卡素會對佢既發展會較好。對車路士黎講，比多年時間Kenedy進步，等佢準備好番黎爭正選位置，即使唔岩用既話，經過一個球季後，佢既身價隨時升多一倍，會賣到個更好既價錢。

Mikel accuses Conte of showing a lack of respect in forced Chelsea exit

John Obi Mikel has accused Chelsea boss Antonio Conte of displaying a lack of respect as he was forced towards the exits at Stamford Bridge in 2016-17.

The Nigeria international had spent a decade on the Blues’ books when another change in the dugout brought an Italian tactician to west London.

Conte quickly deemed Mikel surplus to requirements, despite a loyal servant boasting two Premier League titles, three FA Cups, a Champions League crown and Europa League triumph on an enviable CV.

Once frozen out a parting of ways became inevitable and the 31-year-old eventually moved on to CSL side Tianjin Teda in January 2017.

Mikel is disappointed at how his time at Chelsea came to an end, but the club still holds a special place in his heart regardless of Conte’s actions.

He told The Sun on his time in England: “Definitely it was the right time [to leave] because when you have a manager who... you have to come in whoever you are - manager or player - there are people who have been there before who made this club what it is today.

“Chelsea was nowhere near what it is 10, 15 years ago. There are players that build and build and build, then it’s all about respect.

“When you don’t get that from a manager who comes in and after five minutes decides to make a change you deal with it, you move on.

“My connection with the club has not changed because of the manager or because of a certain person.

“My relationship with the club remains. I am a blue and I want to remain that way for years and years to come.”

http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/mikel-accuses-conte-of-showing-a-lack-of-respect-in-forced/1miisqoh0yaxl1p5povz7i4bwk

While an offer from the Los Blancos hasn't come in yet, it is very unlikely that Pochettino leaves Spurs this summer.
